Before transitioning into technical and media-heavy roles, Jof Davies developed customer-facing and operational discipline through early employment.

Cineworld (2003–2005): Gained foundational operational experience in customer service, shift-based operations, and high-throughput environments. This period strengthened interpersonal communication and process reliability.

Barclaycard (2005–2006): Worked in a financial service setting requiring accuracy, data handling, and compliance with regulated workflows.

These early positions provided a baseline for structured working, adherence to regulated processes, and clear communication—skills that later supported large-scale CRM, data, and automation projects.
